We are comforted that Bob's legacy will continue on through his contributions to his community, through the Kenai River Sport Fishing Association, and through his strong and supportive family. To Jeannie, his kids, grandkids and great grands‚Äî know that our prayers are with you. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FrPA1mvaQAAsml4.jpg

Bob was a businessman & engaged in his community. He helped found @alaskardc & the Mayor's Charity Ball, but he seemed happiest on the river, surrounded by friends & family. I‚Äôll miss the quiet moments flipping for reds or enjoying a glass of good red wine around the fire pit. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FrPA0y_aAAA9rFg.jpg

Bob worked with Senator Stevens to build the Kenai River Classic, and I later joined him to establish the Kenai Kids Classic and then the Kenai River Women's Classic ‚Äì fishing events designed to instill a love and appreciation for the amazing Kenai. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FrPA0MZacAAH5sa.jpg

I‚Äôve known Bob since I was a young girl & my husband, Verne, knew Bob before he knew me. We shared a love for fishing & the Kenai River is a special place for us because of Bob. Bob brought people together to not only fish the river, but to learn to care for it and its bounty. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FrPAzXnaQAAc2vp.jpg

Today Alaska lost a strong civic leader, the Kenai River lost a fierce protector, and my family and I lost a dear friend as Bob Penney passed after 90 years of a life well lived. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FrPAyR2aYAIp5TB.jpg
